replies.msg:
呢幾年球員換左好多
有咁上下年資既漢丹，Nokia
管理層就奧西同辛尼迪
其實舊人唔多

英超幫同意大利本土派都係親干地既
LKK, G5, 羊，巴雷拉，夏雞，森西，山神呢堆肯定係干地既
佢個位其實好穩
隊波係三冠之後最團結，班球員都唔係搞事底，大部份都撐干

我支持留干地，不過始終以球會最大，如果決定換屌SIR，作為球迷都接受到。
雖然係干有問題，換人、正選、向管理層開火，但無可否認今季成績好好：
1. 傷咁多人，但係聯賽績分 (82分) 平三冠王紀錄
2. 歐霸入決賽。呢幾年歐戰成績唔係好，今年過到基達菲、利華、薩克達已經好好。
當光頭佬掹車邊入到前四，大家願意畀多年時間佢；干地第一年拎第二名，點解反而想佢走，唔想畀多一年佢？
其實隊波好後生，就算漢丹都可以打多幾年，絕對唔係三冠嗰時咁，今次拎唔到就可能冇下次。

關於Gagliardini，全世界絕大部份球迷都唔滿意佢，但其實我相信出佢係有「特別」原因：
當時傷晒中場局住出佢，但佢踢得好差仲要空門飛機，間接斷送爭冠機會。之後佢畀球迷、報章圍攻，仲受到死亡恐嚇。呢個時間係佢最低潮時期，我諗干地係唔想放棄佢，亦唔想令到其他球員都覺得佢係罪人，寧願犧牲成績換團結，慢慢大家嘅視線由屌G5變成屌干地。
當然仲有戰術考慮，佢係中場最高嗰個。
至於史堅，好簡單一個現實問題，豪門都已經有晒目標，今時今日仲有邊隊波捨得畀50M+買佢。講緊熱刺對佢有興趣，但我又唔覺得佢地肯出錢
btw 杜曹唔信伊卡迪，其實係預咗佢呢種踢法點踢巴黎

不過講真干地留隊
以今年表現同信任程度黎睇史堅同大力神應該都係咁先
史堅唔差但唔好期望打得返17/18既水準,最多不過不失
至於大力神,由蛆到車干地都未用過呢type既中場,甚至傳緊馬洛達買佢唔買vidal係不和既原頭
就算買晒人升晒lv,我都唔覺佢1個月內可以完全夾到隊波
呢方面真係好尷尬

Barcelona Trio Arturo Vidal, Lionel Messi & Luis Suarez Could All End Up At Inter Italian Media Claims

Barcelona central midfielder Arturo Vidal remains at the top of Inter manager Antonio Conte’s wishlist for the midfield according to a report in today’s print edition of Italian daily newspaper Corriere della Sera. The Chilean national team player is one of several players set to leave Barcelona in the not so distant future and he may not be the only Barcelona player who ends up at Inter either.

Inter have long been linked with making a potential move for Barcelona captain and multi-time world player of the year Lionel Messi and the Argentine yesterday told the club of his decision that he wishes to leave. Signing Messi remains a very difficult dream for Inter and his signing is completely unrelated to Inter’s accounts and will need a direct input from club owners Suning. It is difficult and in any case the 33-year-old will be the one who decides where his future lies.Barcelona have shown an interest in signing Lautaro Martinez but negotiations between the two clubs have stopped. Should the Argentine leave the Nerazzurri, Inter could possibly replace him with Luis Suarez, who has been told he is not in Barcelona’s plans, even if he has an €18 million a year salary...

Inter have agreed terms with Crystal Palace over striker Alexander Sorloth according to a report from Italian radio station Radio Rai 2, which was broadcast a short time ago.

The details of the negotiations between the two clubs are as yet unknown but the Nerazzurri club have seemingly wrapped up a deal that will see the Norwegian national team player join the club.

Sorloth failed to live up to expectations in the Premier League but had a stellar season whilst out on loan at Turkish Super Lig side Trabzonspor in the recently concluded 2019/20 season.

The deal for the 24-year-old former FC Midtjylland player has been reached despite the fact he still has one year left to go on his loan deal with Trabzonspor, who have an obligation to buy him if certain conditions are met.

Despite this situation, any offers must still be made to Crystal Palace because Sorloth is not officially Trabzonspor’s.In 49 appearances across all competitions, Sorloth scored an impressive total of 33 goals and he also provided his teammates with a total of 11 assists for a total of 44 goal contributions.

Brescia主席Cellino承認，AC米蘭正與其接洽收購Tonali事宜，佢亦稱讚馬甸尼十分認真。同時Cellino話馬洛達一直對Tonali有強烈興趣，於是佢地冇向其他球會兜售Tonali，並等待同國米交易，但到依加國米都未提出報價。

Cellino又指，Brescia唔急於售賣球員，反而Tonali就比較急，希望知道自己嘅下一家球會。

分析指，Cellino嘅說法係想推Tonali畀AC米蘭，因為佢地都想要筆錢買人，下季馬上升返意甲；另外就係逼國米盡快提出報價。

目前國際米蘭已取得球員加盟意向，並達成個人條款，所以國米一直都唔心急，且希望先出售一名中場球員，例如JM、Vecino或尼恩高蘭，然後再報價，否則就未必有錢買Tonali。

quote.msg:
指地要Vidal唔要Tonali係唔合邏輯。4月傾好咗個人條款，當時教練係干地，佢有拍板呢宗交易，而且係干地最鍾意嘅意大利人；到依加干地同管理層開完會，國米都冇撤回報價，正如上面巴打講冇放風話唔再有興趣，到現在AC米蘭介入。

Vidal係最近先出現於轉會市場，而國米轉會策略一直都係play smart，如果有得免簽都會衝，無論干地是否存在，當然干地喺度就一定會試。而且Vidal係期望免簽，財政上對於Tonali嘅交易未必太大影響。如果要錢買Vidal，國米唔會去馬，所以呢單都並非十拿九穩。

簡單而言，AC米蘭爭贏，原因係佢地嘅報價好過我地，而唔係干地唔要。

replies.msg: 入干地數好正常，呢個交易一早傾好，布雷西亞同球員都肯，而家係我哋唔肯完成交易，布雷西亞咁咪搵其他球隊競爭，干地之前肯拍板係因為維度唔喺市場，而家喺市場咪首選維度，佢咪變成備選，球隊唔撤銷交易係因為維度交易唔明朗，佢哋咪拖住布雷西亞睇下最後點囉，最好唔好畀我講中最後兩個都簽唔到

An intermediary is at work trying to get Inter central defender Milan Skriniar to Paris Saint-Germain according to a report from Italian broadcaster Sky Sport Italia’s transfer market expert Gianluca Di Marzio, which was aired a short time ago.

The Slovakian national team player would be the replacement for the recently departed Thiago Silva, who joined Chelsea but as things currently stand Paris Saint-Germain have made no offers to Inter for the former Sampdoria player.

The report explains that Inter would like to sign Chelsea midfielder N’Golo Kante in the transfer window to bolster their squad but before being able to do so they must boost their coffers by selling some players with Skriniar among the names who could be sold to raise all important transfer funds.

The sporting director of Inter then went into the specifics of some negotiations that have seen or still see the Nerazzurri club involved. From the transfer of Tonali to Inter to the situations involving Nainggolan, Vidal and Kolarov: "I cannot say that I had Tonali in hand, since I have never started a real negotiation with Brescia. Tonali is a good player, but at the moment Inter are unable to make an investment of that type and have not considered the player as a priority. I repeat that we must first think about thinning and then buying. Nainggolan is an Inter asset, he has two years of contract and he made himself available to the club and the coach. We will evaluate him carefully and I do not rule out that he may stay, since he can improve in many things but we are talking about an excellent player. He is not our player, if there are favorable conditions we will evaluate them. For Kolarov, on the other hand, there is a negotiation with Roma and with the player, we are carrying out the situation in a clear and transparent way. still several things to solve, but he is a player we are interested in and that we can take under certain conditions. Lautaro? There was an approach with the player from Barcelona, ​​but we never started a negotiation. There was a clause that was never exercised and from the day it expired we considered Lautaro out of the market. "

HAKIMI: "I'LL GIVE MY ALL: INTER FANS, WE'LL DO GREAT THINGS"

Why did you choose Inter and what do you expect?
"I chose Inter because I think the coach’s style is similar to my way of playing and that could be very helpful to the team. We’ll try to get some big results and of course we’ll try to win the Scudetto."

What do you think of Antonio Conte?
"He’s a great coach, with a really competitive mindset. He’s got a really great passion for football and he gives that to the players, fans and everyone at the Club. His motivation allows the team to by alive and lively in every game."

Are you the heir to Maicon?
"Maicon was an incredible full-back, with a lot of physicality. Obviously I’d like to follow in his footsteps, but I hope to go my own way and by remembered like he is in the fans’ hearts."

You’re coming off the back of a great season in the Bundesliga; how important was it as an experience and what differences do you expect from Serie A?
"Playing in Germany allowed me to grow. I gained more trust, experience and maturity. It was a great experience, now I expect to play in a more tactical league."

Have you already been able to discover Milan?
"I haven’t been able to explore the city too much yet. I’ve tried a few great restaurants; I’ll have time to get to know it bet. I’m sure I’ll like it."

What’s been the best moment of your career?
"Definitely when I won the Champions League with Real Madrid. It was something I’d dreamed of ever since I was a kid. And the other one was being able to play at a World Cup with Morocco."

Who was your childhood hero?
"Definitely Marcelo, I say it time and time again. I’ve always loved the way he plays, then I met him and could appreciate his personality even more - his happiness on and off the pitch."

In which position do you feel most comfortable?
"Definitely on the wing, I feel best when playing out wide. I’ll always give 100%, not matter where I’m playing."

Do you like any sports other than football?
"I play padel with my friends every now and then, I like basketball too."

You faced Inter at San Siro with Borussia Dortmund: what feelings did that give you?
"It was a great experience; I could feel the fantastic atmosphere the fans created. Now I’ll be able to enjoy it on the home team."

Which past Inter player did you admire?
"Samuel Eto’o, even though I don’t play in the same position as him, he was a source of inspiration. He made history. I always liked how he lived for football and that he’s a symbol of Africa too, my home."

How will you suit Conte’s 3-5-2 formation?
"I’ll adapt well because we playing in the same system at Dortmund in the last year. With the quality we have in this team, it’ll be even easier."

Which Inter players do you know?
"Mostly the ones who won the treble; there were a lot of great champions in that side. But so many great players have worn this jersey."

What did you think when you got the offer from Inter?
"I thought it could be a great chance to grow. The fans here live for football in a special way. I’m at a great Club."

What team did you support as a child?
"I’ve always been a Real Madrid fan. I developed there, from the time I was 7 years old, then I even played for them."

What are your objectives for the season?
"The objective is the team’s: win the Scudetto is the main one, in order to bring happiness to the fans. Then, make progress in the Champions League and do better than we did last season."

Who is faster, you or Alphonso Davies?
"A good challenge! He’s really quick. I don’t know who’d win between me and him. Certainly, watching him play is amazing."

The Derby against AC Milan is coming up soon, what do you think about that?
"I just hope to win it, so that the fans can enjoy it. We want Milan to be Black and Blue."

What is your message for the Inter fans?
"I’m here to give my all. We’re doing great things together and we’ll try to win a title or two!"
